**Autopoiesis** can be defined as the ratio between the complexity of a system and the complexity of its environment. [Fernandez 2013](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autopoiesis#cite_note-Fern%C3%A1ndez-12)
**Complexity** measures in [different domains](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complexity):
__algorithmic information theory / Kolmogorov complexity:__ the length of the shortest binary program that outputs that string
__information processing:__ a measure of the total number of properties (often referred to as a state) transmitted by an object and detected by an observer
__physical systems:__ a measure of the probability of the state vector of the system
__network theory:__ a very unequal distribution of certain measures, with some elements being highly connected and some having very few connections
**Modularity** in graphs:
definition: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modularity_(networks)
networkx: https://networkx.github.io/documentation/stable/reference/algorithms/community.html#module-networkx.algorithms.community.modularity_max
["Modularity in Mathematics"](https://www.andrew.cmu.edu/user/avigad/Talks/toulouse5.pdf); **Jeremy Avigad** (2016)
["The Architecture of Complexity"](http://www2.econ.iastate.edu/tesfatsi/ArchitectureOfComplexity.HSimon1962.pdf); **Herbert Simon** (1962)
**Resilience** quantitative measures:

["Resilience analysis: a mathematical formulation to model resilience of engineering systems"](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/320595148_Resilience_analysis_a_mathematical_formulation_to_model_resilience_of_engineering_systems); Sharma, Tabandeh, Garboni (2017)
quantify the resilience associated with a given **recovery curve**
develop a rigorous mathematical model of the **recovery process**
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2Fpaconathan%2F7p9ax4R7Qg.png?alt=media&token=87a187bc-ff69-4f48-ad3c-dbb9761b3633)
depends on `Q(t)` **system state indicators** to provide a measure of system functionality over a period of time
used for examining **shocks** to a system
["A Mathematical Review of Resilience in Ecology"](https://doi.org/10.1111/nrm.12097); Katherine Meyer (2016)
use the language of **dynamical systems** to organize and scrutinize existing resilience definitions within a unified framework
provide an introduction for mathematicians to the **ecological** concept of resilience, a potential area for expanded quantitative research
resilience to parameter changes (state‐space perturbations) has been quantified by viewing parameters as **state variables** but has also considered the **reversibility** of parameter shifts
[Mathematical Modeling of System Resilience](https://www.riverpublishers.com/book_details.php?book_id=704); Kanchan Das, Mangey Ram (2019)

__resilience creation for various system aspects including a functional system of the supply chain, overall supply chain systems; various methodologies for modeling system resilience; satellite-based approach for addressing climate related risks, repair-based approach for sustainable performance of an engineering system, and modeling measures of the reliability for a vertical take-off and landing system__
["Defining Resilience Mathematically: From Attractors to Viability"](http://www.patres-project.eu/images/5/57/Chap3V7.pdf); Martin, Deffuant, Calabrese (2009)
a chapter within [PATRES](http://patres-project.eu/index.php?title=Main_Page)
perhaps the closest definition of resilience in terms of RL practices

consider definitions derived from dynamical systems theory (stable
equilibria, attraction domains)
socio-ecological problems often require the identification of efficient policies of action that can favour the resilience of the system

a definition of resilience based on the mathematical theory of **viability**  overcomes these limitations: the desired property is an a priori defined subset of the state space, and need not contain attractors
the set of resilient states is defined as the capture basin of the viability kernel of this desired set
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2Fpaconathan%2FnSyHgGy9UA.png?alt=media&token=820d1a97-754b-4d1d-99e7-c1dda641e92f)
the desired property of a system can be defined as a **subset of the state space** without any specific conditions, and not as a set of attractors
good stable equilibria are replaced by the **viability kernel** of the constraint set representing the desired property
resilience is defined by the **capture basin** of the viability kernel: the points for which the exists a policy of action leading to the viability kernel
resilience value: **the inverse of time**, or more generally the cost, for driving back the system into the viability kernel
therefore it is possible to derive action policies to keep or restore the desired property

Risk Model
Overview

Derwen, Inc., develops models to assess the risks of relationships with specific clientele. Of course, we "dogfood" by using these data products for risk modeling within our own partnering strategies and price/bid determination.
`risk = probability × consequences`
Due to our needs for mitigating risk, we assess the risks of each potential relationship among our clientele.
Due diligence applies not only to organizations among our clientele, but also to their employees, contractors, directors, investors, vendors, and customers.
Those which score on the high-end of risk measures are isolated from further interaction.
Those which score moderately are assessed a N% surcharge to offset the likelihood of their default.
Data Products

This analysis is intended to provide leading signals about our positioning for alliances, based on which orgs are most likely to become abrupt failures.  For example, there will be tragedies due to healthcare policy failures in the wake of this global pandemic. Similarly, there will be major upheaval within the commercial sector, as large organizations go out of business abruptly due to poor "corporate hygiene" practices.
The primary use cases are:
estimate effective boundaries (scale?) for regionalism
risk assessment about alliances
Contraindicating Factors
organization charted outside of Western States Pact
poor practices for security, privacy, ethics, code of conduct
ineffective use of digital communications/collaboration
overemphasis on financialization
ties with hostile states, including Russia and China
2nd degree affiliation with Koch, Mercer, etc.
subscribing to belief that a text is sacred
primarily human-centric philosophy
aristotelian thinking
any involvement in ALEC, CPAC
amassing tech debt for infrastructure
swimming upstream of technology trends: GPT, J-curves, survival analysis, etc.
any prior Derwen security incident report
federalism:
pushing for larger structures / highly leveraged deals / longer supply chains
libertarianism:
neo-liberalism:
corporatism:
"rule of objectivity" editorial stance
following GOP positioning on COVID-19 policy responses
apologetics for Zoom and other systematic security risks
arguments for economic precedence over crisis interventions
poor use of online media within collaborative environments
exit NDAs
culture:
cult of personality
leaders bullying
happy talk
cognitive bias among exec staff, BoD
environmental, i.e., close ties to regions with:
limited freshwater supplies
aquifer subsidence
persistent AQI hazards
storm surge, sea level rise, king tides
major storms
flooding
practices prone to pandemics
Methods

Probe for rhetorical posture, then assess spread across the "network consensus vs. network dissent" spectrum. Base analysis on anti-patterns that reveal inherent failure modes for cognitive bias, given the current environment.
Knowledge graph representation:
dependency graph of shared/inferred risk (centrality metrics)
weak supervision to create labels contra-indications
resilience function to account for the delta
modeled as evolved bayesian networks of labels' influence per node
ablation (chaos monkey-ish) to sample crises
Active Measures
Use this analysis to assess both individuals and organizations, applying our "two strikes" rule.
While there are legal limitations to overt countermeasures against individuals, competitive intelligence practices are authorized.
Use social media to shape affiliations:
bad actors: ensure no more than 3rd degree connections
systematically poor decision-making: no more than 2nd degree

["The Decision-Making Side of Machine Learning: Computational, Inferential and Economic Perspectives"](https://anyscale.com/blog/videos-and-slides-for-the-first-ray-summit-connect-may-13-2020/); Michael Jordan (2020)

effects of market mechanisms on machine learning (as an instance thereof)
early era of ML: essentially **pattern recognition** (supervised learning)
contemporary need for **explanations** and **dialog** about decisions
multiple decision-makers, **decentralized** approaches (e.g., markets)
sequences of decisions => **policy**

__Cassie Kozyrkov and Jacob Ward are two of the top people who've been speaking about cognitive bias and decision science, in juxtaposition to data science. In other words, data science teams can go only so far to develop insights, but then entirely different processes come into play for how groups make decisions. In particular, it was interesting Cassie how covered Google's frustrations internally at having advanced ML, but then not having an organization that could make effective use in its decision-making process.__
["The Missing Piece"](https://www.oreilly.com/radar/the-missing-piece-ai-uk-18/); Cassie Kozyrkov (2018)
["How social science research can inform the design of AI systems"](https://www.oreilly.com/radar/podcast/how-social-science-research-can-inform-the-design-of-ai-systems/); Jacob Ward (2018)

[Decision Quality: Value Creation from Better Business Decisions](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/29366421-decision-quality);  Carl Spetzler, Hannah Winter, Jennifer Meyer (2016)
[Carl Spetzler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Spetzler)
**This deliverable is structured as a book outline**

__The following is a collection of personal notes. Most of these points compare personal reflections from previous economic crises w.r.t. the current pandemic. The thinking is especially targeted at questions about leading an early stage technology venture.__
**Outline**
Immediate needs: **How to position effectively**
define **pseudo-jackpot**
identify **advice** for how to respond to abrupt changes as a result of a global pandemic and economic crisis.
**avoid**… economists, libertarians, abrahamisms, etc.
many of the **experts** who monopolized the stage mere months before, will no longer find a podium months later
many of those who are deeply vested in approaches that worked previously will hold tenaciously to the past, and may become **extreme risks**
biggest predictor in tech industry for your future performance, especially during a crisis:  **the company that you keep**
an example of **evidence-based policymaking** applied at a microeconomic level
[Steely Dan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Any_Major_Dude_Will_Tell_You)
Lookback for modeling: **Earlier instances of pseudo-jackpot** – an industry forecasting instrument we’ve been using
Feature engineering: **Which factors now change the most?**  – qualifying criteria for making judgements about who/what to exclude
Early outlines of the AI pseudo-jackpot
**resilience**: the ability of an entity to remain healthy even in the presence of **risk** factors

**growth** and **scale** are not as effective estimators for business success – not when compared against: **resilience**, **decentralized decision-making**, and **network effects**; let's build modeling to determine boundaries for **resilience** and effective scale – including governments
Modeling: **develop models to assess risk**
used for clientele **surcharge** (like insurance, based on likelihood of non-payment, damaged reputation, or other business risks)
Big Picture outcomes: **An ascendance of bioregionalism** – we have data monitoring in place about opportunities among our clientele

**resilience** vs. scale also applies to government: we've seen compelling evidence that blind faith in **federalism** is lethal: state governments organizing into regional pacts (representing 60% of GDP) which coordinated to act in direct opposition to the delegitimized federal government

regardless of constitutional interpretations or nationalist screeds, federalist practices led to obscene amounts of needless deaths as well as widespread economic turmoil; it represents a **tangible business risk** and small businesses especially must take that into account

Example takeaway: **a scenario to consider** – much too long-winded, but we’re finding opportunities among our better clients: take a sharp left-turn on optimization strategies, focus on logistics + AI meets competitive intelligence, then bet against the identified failing parts
[“The Coronavirus Is Rewriting Our Imaginations”](https://www.newyorker.com/culture/annals-of-inquiry/the-coronavirus-and-our-future) by KSR
Examples takeaway: "**start-up insurance**" – clientele get assessed a **surcharge** based on resilience risk modeling of their practices and environment
most successful ventures already build some risk mitigation into their pricing models, albeit these tend to be ad-hoc; we present a data-driven approach with explainable decisions included

resilience modeling has historically has prohibitively high computational costs; although the features/factors become more apparent due to global crisis and the compute resources have become more cost-effective
analog: enterprise organizations typically require start-ups to purchase insurance policies to indemnify against disasters, lawsuits, unemployment, etc. – subject to **compliance audits**

in contrast, a data-driven insurance "premium" baked into clientele rates as a **resilience surcharge** fully embraces enterprise practices and represents a new avenue for compliance-based industry initiatives
rates for existing clientele are subject to annual review
rates for prospective clientele may be simplified as `[no surcharge, surcharge, no engagement]` depending on the level of risk
explainable models are of course a requirement, as are efforts to take into account issues of fairness and bias in the data
everyone in business is to some extent in the insurance business
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2Fpaconathan%2FKEySkDl50a.png?alt=media&token=90706eb6-9d7a-4985-96e2-ef95e6ecfebb)
these practices provide a framework for legal use of [Active Measures](((KFEtDLcIC)))

**Next Steps**
Goal: **adapt post into a position paper that Derwen, Inc. can reference strategically**
Components to consider towards goal: **thought leaders in industry referencing this**
Target outcomes for goal:

update corporate policy based on resilience risk modeling as a surcharge for clientele that exceed __acceptable risk__ but are within limits of __tolerable risk__ given an **assessed premium**  (DONE)

publish a **research paper** (Arxiv, etc.) about use of Bayesian Networks, Reinforcement Learning, Viability Kernels, Knowledge Graph, and other adjacent technologies to assess parameters for resilience risk models – as support for the corporate policy
overall:
**increase alliances with other firms pursuing similar strategies**
distance our firm from current bad actors in business
prevent new client engagements that bring intolerable risks
adjust pricing for client engagements that have tolerable risks
